Brooklyn Historical Society
Eastern Parkway Coalition records
Eastern Parkway Coalition.
2007.016
12.5 Linear Feet in nine record cartons, six rolled document cases, one oversize flat box, and one loose rolled item
1952-2007 1970-2007 The collection is composed of the records of the Eastern Parkway Coalition, dating from 1952 to 2007 (bulk dates, 1970-2007). These records are primarily composed of subject files, which document many issues which affected the Crown Heights and Prospect Heights neighborhoods of Brooklyn. These issues include community gardens, housing/tenant rights, mass transit, summer youth programs, drug abuse, environmentalism, mental health, public parks, and urban renewal. In addition to subject files, the records include a series of plans and maps for the reconstruction of Eastern Parkway and other streets in the area.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Eastern Parkway Coalition records, 2007.016, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Processing Information
Collection processed to the file level.
Scope and Contents note
The collection is composed of the records of the Eastern Parkway Coalition, dating from 1952 to 2007 (bulk dates, 1970-2007). These records are primarily composed of subject files, which document many issues which affected the Crown Heights and Prospect Heights neighborhoods of Brooklyn. These issues include include community gardens, housing/tenant rights, mass transit, summer youth programs, drug abuse, environmentalism, mental health, public parks, and urban renewal. In addition to subject files, the records include a series of plans and maps for the reconstruction of Eastern Parkway and other streets in the area.
Conditions Governing Access note
Open to users without restriction.
Arrangement
The records are organized into two series:
Series 1: Subject files, 1952-2007
Series 2: Plans and maps, 1973-1988
Conditions Governing Use
The copyright status for photographs and recordings in this collection have not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
Historical note
The Eastern Parkway Coalition (EPC) is a community organization based in the Crown Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn. Established in the 1970s, the organization ran summer youth programs, many of which focused on community improvement and gardening. The group established a community garden atop the Franklin Avenue Shuttle subway station at the Botanic Garden/Eastern Parkway/Union Street. In 1989, New York City Transit Police demolished the community garden with the intention of clearing the land for a parking lot. The garden was later reestablished due to community outrage. As of 2011, the EPC continues to sponsor community gardening programs in the Crown Heights and surrounding neighborhoods of Brooklyn.
Related Materials

Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Constance Lesold, 2007.

Series 1: Subject files2123311 Linear Feetin ten record cartons and one oversize flat box1952-20071970-2007
Scope and Contents
The series contains subject files of the Eastern Parkway Coalition, and includes documents dating from 1952 to 2007.
The files were maintained by Constance Lesold, who was also an active member of other community groups, such as Community Board 8/9, the Brooklyn Tenants Union, and local block associations. Files related to those other organizations appear frequently in the series.
The series documents several issues relating to the Crown Heights and Prospect Heights neighborhoods of Brooklyn from the 1970s to the early 2000s. These issues include community gardens, housing/tenant rights, mass transit, summer youth programs, drug abuse, environmentalism, mental health, public parks, the Haitian community, and urban renewal.
Community gardens are especially well represented in the files, especially the Franklin Avenue Shuttle Garden, which was demolished by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) in 1989. Controversy over the Brooklyn Botanic Garden charging entrance fees is also addressed in the series.
Cultural affairs are also featured in the series, especially the Brooklyn Museum, the Brooklyn Public Library, and the New Muse.
The files are primarily composed of flyers, publications, correspondence, memoranda, and clippings. A small amount of files include photographs, slides, negatives, and audio cassettes.
Arrangement
The files in this series were recieved in a disorganized state and are not arranged in any particular order. Unfoldered documents were placed in folders and labeled by the processing archivist. Includes Franklin Avenue Shuttle reportsEastern Parkway Coalition proclamation212341989OS-30Series 2: Plans and maps214161.5 Linear Feetin six rolled document cases, one oversize flat box, and one loose rolled item1973-1988
Scope and Contents
The series contains plans and maps for the reconstruction and redevelopment of Eastern Parkway and other streets in the Prospect Heights and Crown Heights neighborhoods of Brooklyn, dating from 1973 to 1988. The series also includes district maps and plans for playground reconstruction. There are eleven sets of plans and maps in total, along with two folders of related documents. The plans and maps were produced by the City of New York.New York Housing and Development Administration - Crown Heights Community Planning Districts No. 8 and 9 map21429197316-Reconstruction of Eastern Parkway plans21424198312-Reconstruction of the Playground and Comfort Station at Underhill Avenue and Prospect Place, Brooklyn21419198410
